messages.subject: Re: household tornadoes
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/1/2003 5:53:12 PM Central Standard Time, ... Somebody said something to me once that helps me in letting go of  the little voice that says
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/1/2003 5:53:12 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> OR, can you get past that thing that says your house has to be clean?
> Just do the basics and let the rest go until your kids are bigger and
> don't need you with them all the time. You will have too much time to
> clean when they've gone from you


Somebody said something to me once that helps me in letting go of the little
voice that says I'm not keeping the house as clean as my mother did. She
said, 'We probably don't remember what the house looked like when we were
three or six or nine. Our memories are probably from when we were older and
didn't play with Hot Wheels and Legos and mud anymore. And we were away at
school all day and my mom was home cleaning... And I think of those sad
poems about old ladies with no one to get their house messy.

Pam T.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
